title: Heidegger - The End of Philosophy
description:
The End of Philosophy by Martin Heidegger- PDF
Translated by Joan Stambaugh 
Published by University of Chicago Press, 2003
ISBN 0226323838, 9780226323831
110 pages

Description:

Joan Stambaugh's translations of the works of Heidegger, accomplished with his guidance, have made key aspects of his thought and philosophy accessible to readers of English for many years. This collection, writes Stambaugh, contains Heidegger's attempt "to show the history of Being as metaphysics," combining three chapters from the philosopher's Nietzsche ("Metaphysics as a History of Being," "Sketches for a History of Being as Metaphysics," and "Recollection in Metaphysics") with a selection from VortrÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¤ge und AufsÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¤tze ("Overcoming Metaphysics").
